It works !

Thanks for the tutorial. FYI, one can now use the syntax @import ~bootstrap/scss/bootstrap with Angular CLI to simplify SASS imports from node_modules packages.

In this configuration, how would one override the value for Bootstrap variables to change default Bootstrap stylings when using SASS? For example if a different $font-size-base were desired to reset the global base font size?

If I understand what you're asking, it's the order in which you are calling each file. So the import file placed below Bootstrap will take precedence in the DOM. So placing your @import "custom" below @import "../../node_modules/bootstrap/scss/bootstrap". will overwrite/take precedence over @import "../../node_modules/bootstrap/scss/bootstrap". It's been a while since I've used the SASS config, are you having issues? After work today I can try and recreate the issue?

Thanks for the reply! I think I've figured out how to override Bootstrap variables. Here's what I've done in our project:

Removed Bootstrap from .angular-cli.json. (Only load styles.scss in .angular-cli.json.
In variables.scss, override any Bootstrap 4 variables. (Also @import "~bootstrap/scss/functions"; & @import "~bootstrap/scss/variables"; to make them available in overridden & project-specific variables.)
In styles.scss, place @import variables.scss before @import ~bootstrap/scss/bootstrap; so that the overridden variable values are used when processing Bootstrap SASS.
do you have any idea how to use bootswatch 4 themes scss version in angular 5?

I think you could create a src/vendor/bootswatch directory (or whatever you want). Copy and paste the files from bootswatch website into that directory. ie. main.scss, _variables.scss, etc (Forget which ones they are) into that folder, and just import them into your styles.scss folder. like @import "../../vendor/bootswatch/_vendor.scss" etc etc. Im going off of memory. Just make sure you order the files in the correct order. You might have to play with it.

You could also follow this tutorial which has more in depth sass explanation; but instead of importing files from node_modules you'd just import them from wherever you put your bootswatch files. I believe you need to also include vanilla bootstrap to work with bootswatch. https://scotch.io/tutorials...

The idea is to import your bootswatch files into styles.scss, because that folder will be compiled. Hope this helps.

Hi Colin. Thanks and congratulations for your article, it really helped me!
I let you know that i've installed bootstrap, popper and jquery without version specification and I had a problem for start the app because I had to add the "dist" folder at the scripts inclussion of jquery. Finally the correct was: "../node_modules/jquery/dist/jquery.min.js"

Thanks for the comment, different versions of jQuery have the files organized differently. Glad to hear you got it working. Maybe your comment will help future on-lookers that decide to install without a version number.
thanks a lot u r super intelligent
Im glad you found it helpful!
Thanks, for helping out. this worked for me

Glad to hear, and thanks for letting me know! This is a slightly older post so I've been meaning to replicate to make sure it's up to date (still works). Nevertheless, thanks for letting me know, much appreciated!
i have an issue, when i view my site on mobile the render view displays blank. do you know the fix
Im not sure. I'd have to know more information about what you're developing. It could be a number of things.

I was able to fix it..
How can a sort search table be added to keystone. If you have an idea, it will be of great help to me.
Thanks
Doesn't seem to work for me, process.env is just empty regardless of whats in my .env file.
Thank you so much ..you saved my day!

As of Angular 6 the path has change.
Now only one . before the /

Old:
"styles": [
"../node_modules/materialize-css/dist/css/materialize.css",
"styles.css"
],
"scripts": [
"../node_modules/jquery/dist/jquery.min.js",
"../node_modules/materialize-css/dist/js/materialize.js"
],

New:
"styles": [
"./node_modules/materialize-css/dist/css/materialize.css",
"styles.css"
],
"scripts": [
"./node_modules/jquery/dist/jquery.min.js",
"./node_modules/materialize-css/dist/js/materialize.js"
],
Thanks for the info. I'll try and update the post tonight!
https://uploads.disquscdn.c... One horribly inappropriate comment and you'll never be shown another baby photo at work ever again. Totally worth it.
https://uploads.disquscdn.c... What's the difference between a gay man and a freezer? The freezer doesn't fart when you pull your meat out.

Great tools, great tools everywhere ! :D
Been using some of them and tried other and they all rocks, thanks for sharing.
As each team is different, there are many solutions for each one, I would suggest a free online tool we developed at Zenkit, you can give it a try, we'd love your feedbacks: https://zenkit.com

For Future on-lookers, I've created a new post for Angular 6: http://www.colinstodd.com/b...

It's also mentioned in the "Update" section, but I thought I'd mention it here for brevity.
